text:
Hi,

This is from revision 358880, and present in release 2.1.1.

Basically, I was a bit thrown by the text of the "should_save" dialog box. It gives me a warning, then 
asks just a plain Yes or No, and in fact the No also means carry on. I think it's a lot clearer with the text 
"Do you want to save your test plan first?" appended to the message. See patch attached.
creator: asf.bugzilla.acct@wunger.com

text:
Created attachment 17272
The output of "svn diff" for the relevant files.
creator: asf.bugzilla.acct@wunger.com
sebb@apache.org
text:
Thanks for the patch - added to 2.1 branch.

==

Your patch also revealed errors in the non-English properties files - these 
should not have contained the English version of should_save, so I have 
removed those. Other languages will now pick up the new default from 
messages.properties.

[There are some more such duplicate entries which I'll address shortly]
